title: Dmitry Rogozin has been dismissed as director general of Roscosmos [Updated]
summary: A thorn in NASA's side is gone. Will the next guy be any better?

title: Virgin Galactic selects Arizona for spaceplane manufacturing facility
summary: Virgin Galactic announced July 14 plans to assemble a fleet of suborbital spaceplanes in a new factory in a suburb of Phoenix.

title: Rocket Report: Vega-C is a sight to see; will Europe push SpaceX aside?
summary: "I am delighted to see solid progress towards first flight."

title: A common ground system for military satellites is proving to be harder than envisioned
summary: Space Force satellite operators want to move away from having different ground systems for each military constellation

title: NASA division proposing program to send scientists to ISS
summary: A NASA science division is seeking funding for a program that could fly scientists to the International Space Station on private missions to conduct research that could then be handed off to NASA astronauts.

title: Georgia approves Starlink services in Eastern Europe
summary: Georgia became the latest country July 14 to approve SpaceX’s Starlink broadband constellation.

title: GeoOptics, PlanetIQ and Spire to supply NOAA with space weather data
summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration awarded contracts to GeoOptics, PlanetIQ and Spire Global to provide space weather data.

title: SpaceX ready to launch space station resupply mission after five-week delay
summary: SpaceX is set to launch its 25th resupply mission to the International Space Station Thursday night from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, following a five-week delay to resolve a leak in the Dragon cargo capsule’s propulsion system.

title: National Reconnaissance Office seeks proposals from commercial providers of RF space imagery
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office has released a request for proposals from commercial providers of space-based radio frequency (RF) imagery.

title: SpaceX and NASA launch CRS-25 mission to the ISS
summary: SpaceX launched its 25th commercial resupply services (CRS) mission for the International Space Station (ISS) on a flight-proven Falcon 9 while also utilizing a flight-proven Cargo Dragon 2 spacecraft. Falcon 9 B1067-5 lifted Dragon 2 Capsule 208-3 (C208-3) from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) on July 14 at 8:44 PM EDT (00:44 UTC on July 15).
